Q12.question: Which of these best describes your menopausal status?
answers: Perimenopausal (periods are irregular or have stopped for less than 12 months)
Postmenopausal (periods have stopped for 12 consecutive months or more)

Malignant features – Strongly suggestive of breast cancer

Q39.question: Which of these best describes your breast density?
answers: A: Almost entirely fatty (The breasts are almost all fat, with very little fibrous and glandular tissue. This makes it easy to see through the breast and find abnormal changes on a mammogram.)
B: Scattered fibroglandular densities (There are some scattered areas of fibrous and glandular tissue, but the majority of the breast is fatty. A small mass would be visible on a mammogram.)
C: Heterogeneously dense (There are many areas of fibrous and glandular tissue, which makes it hard to find small masses on a mammogram. This may obscure small cancers.)

D: Extremely dense (The breasts are almost entirely made of dense, fibrous, and glandular tissue. This can make it very difficult to see through the breast on a mammogram. This is also associated with a higher risk of breast cancer.)
E: I don't know / I am not sure
